summary: Deep Purple is an English rock band that formed in 1968. They are known for helping to create heavy metal and hard rock music. Their sound changed over time, starting with psychedelic rock. The band's most popular lineup, called Mark II, included Ian Gillan and Roger Glover. Deep Purple has sold over 100 million records and was once recorded as the loudest band in the world. They have had many members over the years, with Ian Paice being the only constant. The band has won many awards and was inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame in 2016.
title: Deep Purple
